title: Take a pic!
description: Back in the 1820s, early cameras would take several hours to actually capture a film! With annoyingly long exposure hours, photographing people with a nice smile was not really possible. Why? Try and hold a convincing smile while staying perfectly still for hours and you will get your answer. Today, the number of photographs clicked every two minutes is same as the number of photographs clicked by mankind in 1800s.
completion_text: Try drawing yourself taking the picture behind that beautiful camera. Perhaps a light for the flash as well?

steps.hint: Définis the `background` color to `blue`
Définis the `stroke` to `0` for now, to avoid drawing the outline of the shapes
Déplace-toi the cursor to place the camera in the center - **tape** `moveTo 100, 150`
Définis the `color` of the camera to `dimgray`
Now draw the body of the camera with a rectangle - **tape** `rectangle 300, 200`
Déplace-toi the cursor to draw the lense - **tape** `move 150, 100`
Définis the `color` of the lens to `lightblue`
Définis the outline of the lens with a `stroke` of `black` color and size `10`
The lens is a `circle` with size `50`
Définis the `color` to `lightgray` for the second half of the lens
Dessine an arc that matches the top half of the lens - **tape** `arc 50, 2, 1`
This camera needs a flash! Déplace-toi the cursor to place it - **tape** `move -30, -125`
Dessine the flash of the camera with a `rectangle` of size `60` by `20`
Définis the `stroke` back to `0`.
Définis the `color` of the flash to `lightblue`
Dessine a polygon for the reflection on the flash - **tape** `polygon 40, 0, 0, 20`
Only the button to shoot the picture is left - **tape** `move 100, 10`
Définis the `color` of the button to `red`.
Dessine the button of the camera with a `rectangle` of size `50` by `15`
One more detail! Déplace-toi the cursor one last time - **tape** `move 25, -20`
Définis the `color` to `yellow`
Définis the `font` to `'ComicSansMS'` and size `30`
Write some text - **tape** `text 'Click!'`
